title: Excoffon
content:
My First Post:   
   
Has any kind of complete visual listing of Roger Excoffon's designs appeared anywhere?   
   
Thanks, chaps
author: rian_hughes

comments.content:
_Rian, first of all.: Welcome to Typophile, I may as well tell you that I am a fan of your work, then.. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)_   
   
You may have already noticed, seen and read some of these.:   
_\> [www.itcfonts.com/ulc/article.asp?sid=PULWCD7F6DG09H11WGKWEJFN07BN7G1C&sec=ulc&issue=articles&art=excoffon](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.itcfonts.com/ulc/article.asp?sid=PULWCD7F6DG09H11WGKWEJFN07BN7G1C&sec=ulc&issue=articles&art=excoffon)   
\> [www.myfonts.com/person/excoffon/roger/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.myfonts.com/person/excoffon/roger/)   
\> [www.linotype.com/7-388-7/rogerexcoffon.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.linotype.com/7-388-7/rogerexcoffon.html)_      
   
_Sadly enough, it seems pretty hard to find decent information, details and / or listings of his work.._

Hey Rian, nice to see you hanging about...   
   
I have a couple of Fonderie Olive specimen books with a bunch of Excoffon designs. I could probably scan a post portions of them if you'd like.   
   
In the meantime, there is also this partial visual index of Excoffon's work from the [Klingspor Museum Offenbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/):   
   
 [http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftdesigner/Excoffon/RExcoffon.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftdesigner/Excoffon/RExcoffon.pdf)

Grant, Olive, ooooh please.   
   
Rian, some print stuff:   
1) S Carter's "20th Century Type Designers" has a page of his fonts.   
2) Issue #12-OldSeries of Herbert Spencer's Typographica has a killer article on Mistral, including highly varied initial sketches that contain many ideas for many unreleased fonts.   
   
And here's a thread you might enjoy:   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/1405.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518053338/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/1405.html)
